content.description: Hard start climbs over the rap and belay anchors.  These anchors were placed to avoid down climbing the gully.  We have been rapping a little to the left of the tree.  I try to look over the edge when I toss the rope to avoid the prickly pear.  After the hard start it gets a bit easier above.  Good rock and fun moves.
content.location: This wall is known as the Bowling Alley as anything knocked loose at the top of the gully goes down it.  Once at the start of the climbs this is not an issue.  Climb the gully right of the Lorax (see Hyrax).  At the top where it is choked with talus move right to sloping ledge with belay anchor.

content.description: Slightly spicy climbing on good gear and relatively easy rock leads to an airy finish on the right arete.
content.protection: Standard rack of singles to blue Camalot and a few bolts.
content.location: Located on a formation called the Lorax.  Work around the right side of the Knight then up slabs to the second fin of rock.  Starts in the center of the face at the toe of the formation.  Follows cracks and seams that stay right of the main buttress.  At a spot where two seams make an X work left then up to bolted face.  Route finished to the left of the arete.  The high bolt is for Hyrax.

content.description: Sustained climbing and interesting moves through sections that from below look harder than they are.
content.location: On the Ball Return it is the bolted line right of the major weakness that is Gutter Ball and it starts in the same place as Finger Fan with a hard move up then a move to the left.

content.description: Obvious dihedral crack system. Bolts and holds lead you left of the roof to the crux.  The fat crack is avoided by climbing the face to the right.  Great airy finish.  Lead ground up by Geir with four bolts place with aid, three were added to take out the R.  The free FA was left for the next party.
content.protection: Bolts and light rack up to #3 camalot.
content.location: Work right past the Knight then follow ramps up hill staying left.  Work past the first fin of rock.  The second taller fin is known as the Lorax.  From the gully on the right side climb dihedral with roof at the top of the dihedral.

content.description: This route was originally done with no bolts.  At the roof JSt went way left then up a crack.  Bolts were added taking all the sting out of the run outs and the finish now goes over the second roof instead of climbing 15 feet left.
content.protection: 3 Bolts and a light rack up to Blue camalot.
content.location: On the Ball Return formation the obvious weakness up the middle.

content.description: Two cruxes and fun moves up a arete/buttress
content.location: On the Ball Return Formation the right most route on the skyline as you approach.  You will need to scramble up a bit to get to the base of the climbs.

content.description: Improbable looking crux section on bullet hard rock.  Leave your packs to the right of the gully where it is flat rather than at the bottom of the gully where rocks might hit them.  We belay off the rap anchors at which are also the first bolt of Rocky Road.  If you rap down rather than downclimbing the gully we have been tossing the rope just the the left of the tree.  Better that it hits an agave than the prickly pear a few feet right.
content.location: This wall is known as the Bowling Alley as anything knocked loose at the top of the gully goes down it.  Once at the start of the climbs this is not an issue.  Climb the gully right of the Lorax (see Hyrax).  At the top where it is choked with talus move right to sloping ledge with belay anchor.

climbs.name: The Bad End Or The Worse End

content.description: Good climbing up face to a short section of crack/flake to more face then two roofs.
content.location: Starts left of the obvious crack up the center of the formation known as the Ball Return.  The crack is called Gutter Ball

content.description: Nine routes ranging in difficulty from 5.9 to 5.10+.  Some are gear and some are sport.  These routes are in two south facing gullies.
